Client API¶

The tempodb.client module is the main entrypoint into the API. Most user code will only need to interact with the tempodb.client.Client class in this module.

class tempodb.client.Client(key, secret)[source]¶

Entry point class into the TempoDB API. The client should be initialized with your API key and secret obtained from your TempoDB login.

The methods are grouped as follows:

SERIES

  • create_series()
  • delete_series()
  • get_series()
  • list_series()
  • update_series()

READING DATA

  • read_data()
  • read_multi()

WRITING DATA

  • write_data()
  • write_multi()

DELETING

  • delete()

SINGLE VALUE

  • single_value()
  • multi_series_single_value()
Parameters:
  • key (string) – your API key
  • secret (string) – your API secret
create_series(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a new series with an optional string key.

Parameters:key (string) – (optional) a string key for the series
Return type:tempodb.response.Response object
delete(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Deletes data in a given series over the timeframe specified by start and end.

Parameters:
  • key (string) – a list of keys for the series to use
  • start (ISO8601 string or Datetime object) – the time to begin deleting from
  • end (ISO8601 string or Datetime object) – the time to end deleting at
Return type:

tempodb.response.Response object
delete_series(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Delete a series according to the given criteria.

Note: for the series_id and key arguments, the filter will return the union of those values. For the tag and attr arguments, the filter will return the intersection of those values.

Parameters:
  • series_id (list or string) – filter by one or more series IDs
  • key (list or string) – filter by one or more series keys
  • tag (list or string) – filter by one or more tags
  • attr (dict) – filter by one or more key-value attributes
  • allow_truncation (bool) – whether to allow full deletion of a database
Return type:

tempodb.response.Response object
get_series(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Get a series object from TempoDB given its key.

Parameters:key (string) – a string name for the series
Return type:tempodb.response.Response object
list_series(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Get a list of all series matching the given criteria.

Note: for the series_id and key arguments, the filter will return the union of those values. For the tag and attr arguments, the filter will return the intersection of those values.

Parameters:
  • series_id (list or string) – filter by one or more series IDs
  • key (list or string) – filter by one or more series keys
  • tag (list or string) – filter by one or more tags
  • attr (dict) – filter by one or more key-value attributes
Return type:

tempodb.response.Response object
multi_series_single_value(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return a single value for multiple series. You can supply a timestamp as the ts argument, otherwise the search defaults to the current time.

The direction argument can be one of “exact”, “before”, “after”, or “nearest”.

The id, key, tag, and attr arguments allow you to filter for series. See the list_series() method for an explanation of their use.

Parameters:
  • key (string) – (optional) a list of keys for the series to use
  • ts (ISO8601 string or Datetime object) – (optional) the time to begin searching from
  • direction (string) – criterion for the search
  • tag (list or string) – filter by one or more tags
  • attr (dict) – filter by one or more key-value attributes
Return type:

tempodb.response.Response object
read_data(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Read data from a series given its ID or key. Start and end times must be supplied. They can either be ISO8601 encoded strings (i.e. 2012-01-08T00:21:54.000+0000) or Python Datetime objects, which will be converted for you.

The function parameter is optional and can include string values such as “sum” and “avg”. This will apply a folding function to your rollup of data. The optional interval parameter will downsample your data according to the given resolution (“1min”, “2day”, etc).

Finally, the optional tz parameter can be used to specify a time zone for your output. Please see here for a list of a valid timezone values.

Parameters:
  • key (string) – the series key to use
  • start (string or Datetime) – the start time for the data points
  • end (string or Datetime) – the end time for the data points
  • function (string) – (optional) the name of a rollup function to use
  • interval (string) – (optional) downsampling rate for the data
  • tz (string) – (optional) the timezone to place the data into
Return type:

tempodb.response.Response object
single_value(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return a single value for a series. You can supply a timestamp as the ts argument, otherwise the search defaults to the current time.

The dire`ction argument can be one of “exact”, “before”, “after”, or “nearest”.

Parameters:
  • key (string) – the key for the series to use
  • ts (ISO8601 string or Datetime object) – (optional) the time to begin searching from
  • direction (string) – criterion for the search
Return type:

tempodb.response.Response object
update_series(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update a series with new attributes. This does not change any of the data written to this series. The recommended workflow for series updates is to pull a Series object down using the get_series() method, change its attributes, then pass it into this method.

Parameters:series (tempodb.protocol.Series object) – the series to update
Return type:tempodb.response.Response object
write_data(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Write a set a datapoints into a series by its key. For now, the tags and attributes arguments are ignored.

Parameters:
  • key (string) – the series to write data into
  • data (list) – a list of DataPoints to write
Return type:

tempodb.response.Response object
write_multi(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Write a set a datapoints into multiple series by key or series ID. Each tempodb.protocol.objects.DataPoint object should have either a key or id attribute set that indicates which series it will be written into:

[
    {"t": "2012-...", "key": "foo", "v": 1},
    {"t": "2012-...", "id": "bar", "v": 1}
]

If a non-existent key or ID is passed in, a series will be created for that key/ID and the data point written in to the new series.

Parameters:data (list) – a list of DataPoints to write
Return type:tempodb.response.Response object
tempodb.client.make_series_url(key)[source]¶

Given a series key, generate a valid URL to the series endpoint for that key.

Parameters:key (string) – the series key
Return type:string
class tempodb.client.with_response_type(t)[source]¶

Decorator for ensuring the Response object returned by the Client object has a data attribute that corresponds to the object type expected from the TempoDB API. This class should not be used by user code.

The “t” argument should be a string corresponding to the name of a class from the tempodb.protocol.objects module, or a single element list with the element being the name of a class from that module if the API endpoint will return a list of those objects.

Parameters:t (list or string) – the type of object to cast the TempoDB response to
